thread.title: Triple-C Injection Molding Introduces A New 3 Steps Management Process
thread.title_full: Triple-C Injection Molding Introduces A New 3 Steps Management Process

author: prbuzz.com
title: Triple-C Injection Molding Introduces A New 3 Steps Management Process
text:
Triple-c injection moulding announces a new innovative injection molding management process in short IMMP.
"We are thrilled to Start with our new 3 steps process," said Roger van der Linden, owner of Triple-c injection molding.
This process is a better way to offer, communicate and design molds with the ultimate goal to create excellent molds and molded custom made parts for customers, in a very transparent manner.
We have heard that new customers had communication problems with their old supplier, which resulted design flaws of their custom made rubber or thermoplastic components. Together with these new customers we brainstormed about our communicating process and how to improve that, this resulted in the 3 steps IMMP;
In short we described this 3-step IMMP:
First step is the designed part analyse and quotation, we will analyse the parts on wall thickness, tapers, in one word on feasible for the molding technology, but also the quantities of request, egg how many parts have to be produced per month or year. In this way we can determine the best tool steel and number of cavities or of we need to make family molds. (in order to safe mold costs) Of course we will present this in a nice presentation during a (skype) meeting.
The second step is mold design ad review: In this phase we will draw the model drawing with 3d cad software and present and discuss the parting lines sprue point and ejector lines.
The third step is the mold building process and the first test, here we will give weekly updates of the molding making process, so our customers can see the progress.
This new process is a game changer for Chinese injection molding makers and their services and it dissolves the current customerâ€™s dissatisfaction with their old suppliers.
For more information contact CEO Roger van der Linden
